#Text=Roast Mushrooms
#Text=To add a meaty depth of flavor to your food , include roasted mushrooms .
#Text=It 's easy to season a sheet of your favorite mushrooms and throw them in the oven while you prepare the rest of your meal .
#Text=Consider using fresh herbs , garlic , balsamic vinegar , oil , or butter .
#Text=Once the roasted mushrooms are tender and fragrant , serve them with a hearty steak or make them the main course of a vegetarian meal .
#Text=Ingredients
#Text=Roasted Mushrooms with Herbs
#Text=of button or cremini mushrooms
#Text=of extra-virgin olive oil
#Text=Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
#Text=8 to 12 sprigs of fresh thyme or rosemary
#Text=2 tablespoons ( 5 g ) of chopped parsley , chives , tarragon , or other fresh herbs
#Text=Makes of mushrooms
#Text=Garlic and Balsamic Roasted Mushrooms
#Text=of mushrooms , wiped clean
#Text=4 cloves of garlic , minced
#Text=of olive oil
#Text=of balsamic vinegar
#Text=1 teaspoon ( 1 g ) of fresh thyme , minced
#Text=Salt and pepper to taste
#Text=4 tablespoons ( 56 g ) of butter , diced
#Text=Makes of mushrooms
#Text=Steps
#Text=Roasted Mushrooms with Herbs
#Text=Preheat the oven to and line a sheet with foil .
#Text=Use a rimmed baking sheet so the mushrooms do n't slide off as you 're transferring them to the oven .
#Text=Tear a sheet of aluminum foil and lay it on the bottom of the rimmed baking sheet .
#Text=If you do n't have aluminum foil , use parchment paper .
#Text=Rinse the mushrooms and cut them into quarters .
#Text=Get out of button or cremini mushrooms and pull off the stems .
#Text=Rinse the mushroom caps under cold water to remove any dirt or debris .
#Text=Then cut each cap into quarters .
#Text=Discard the stems or add them to the pot when you make vegetable stock .
#Text=Mix the mushrooms with olive oil , salt , and pepper .
#Text=Put the mushroom quarters into a bowl and pour of extra-virgin olive oil over them .
#Text=Sprinkle kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste .
#Text=Then use a large spoon to toss the mushrooms until they 're coated with the oil .
#Text={ {

#Text=greenbox : Moroccan Spice Variation : 1/2 teaspoon ( 1 g ) of ground cumin1/4 teaspoon ( 0.5 g ) of ground coriander1/8 teaspoon ( 0.3 g ) of chili powder1/4 teaspoon ( 0.5 g ) of paprika1/4 teaspoon ( 0.5 g ) of ground cinnamon1/2 teaspoon ( 1 g ) of ground ginger } }
#Text=Spread the mushrooms on the sheet and scatter herb sprigs on top .
#Text=Spoon the seasoned mushroom quarters onto the foil-lined sheet .
#Text=Arrange them so they 're in an even layer .
#Text=Then place 8 to 12 sprigs of fresh thyme or rosemary over the mushrooms .
#Text=The herbs will flavor the mushrooms as they cook .
#Text=Roast the mushrooms for 15 minutes and drain the liquid from the pan .
#Text=Put the baking sheet in the preheated oven and cook the mushrooms until they soften a little .
#Text=Then remove the sheet and set a bowl on the counter .
#Text=Carefully tilt the sheet so the liquid from the mushrooms drains into the bowl .
#Text=Save this liquid to use in a different recipe .
#Text=For example , use the liquid as a marinade or seasoning sauce for a stir fry .
#Text=Roast the mushrooms for 30 more minutes .
#Text=Return the baking sheet to the oven and let the mushrooms finish cooking .
#Text=They should become tender and they 'll shrink a little .
#Text=Since you removed the liquid that the mushrooms gave off , they 'll become browned and slightly caramelized instead of mushy .
#Text=Toss the mushrooms with chopped herbs and serve them .
#Text=Turn off the oven and remove the baking sheet .
#Text=Discard the sprigs of thyme or rosemary and spoon the mushrooms into a serving dish .
#Text=Stir in 2 tablespoons ( 5 g ) of chopped parsley , chives , tarragon , or other fresh herbs and then serve the mushrooms while they 're still hot .
#Text=Store the leftover mushrooms in an airtight container for up to 3 to 5 days .
#Text=Garlic and Balsamic Roasted Mushrooms
#Text=Preheat the oven to and grease or line a baking sheet .
#Text=Get out a rimmed baking sheet and lay a sheet of aluminum foil on it .
#Text=If you prefer , spray the sheet with nonstick cooking spray instead .
#Text=If you do n't have a rimmed baking sheet , use a baking dish .
#Text=Wipe the mushrooms with a damp cloth and remove the stems .
#Text=Get out of mushrooms and dip a paper towel in water .
#Text=Wring out the water and wipe the mushrooms with the damp cloth to remove dirt and grit .
#Text=Then pop off the stems from each mushroom and discard them .
#Text=Use your favorite type of mushroom for this recipe .
#Text=For example , try button , cremini , or shiitake .
#Text=Mix the whole mushrooms with garlic , oil , vinegar , and seasonings .
#Text=Put the whole mushrooms into a large bowl and pour of olive oil along with of balsamic vinegar over them .
#Text=Add 4 cloves of minced garlic and 1 teaspoon ( 1 g ) of minced fresh thyme .
#Text=Then use a large spoon to toss the mixture .
#Text=You can also add salt and pepper according to your taste .
#Text=Put the mushrooms on the sheet and scatter butter over them .
#Text=Arrange the mushrooms so they 're in a single layer .
#Text=This will help them roast evenly .
#Text=Then take 4 tablespoons ( 56 g ) of diced butter and sprinkle the small cubes across the mushrooms .
#Text=The butter will melt to create a flavorful sauce as the mushrooms roast .
#Text=Roast the garlic and balsamic mushrooms for 20 to 25 minutes .
#Text=Put the baking sheet into the preheated oven and cook the mushrooms until they 're soft .
#Text=Then remove the baking sheet and serve the mushrooms while they 're still hot .
#Text=The mushrooms and garlic should smell fragrant once the mixture has finished cooking .
#Text=Store the leftover mushrooms in an airtight container for up to 3 to 5 days .
#Text=Tips
#Text=For a simple way to round out a meal , serve roasted mushrooms with crusty bread and a garden salad .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Roasted Mushrooms with Herbs
#Text=Measuring cups and spoons
#Text=Knife and cutting board
#Text=Rimmed baking sheet
#Text=Bowl
#Text=Aluminum foil
#Text=Serving bowl
#Text=Garlic and Balsamic Roasted Mushrooms
#Text=Measuring cups and spoons
#Text=Knife and cutting board
#Text=Baking sheet
#Text=Aluminum foil
